content:
TITLE: Artillery CLI Command Help Usage
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the main CLI commands and options available in Artillery, including run, quick test, and report generation commands. Shows the basic command structure and help flag usage.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/packages/artillery/man/artillery.1.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
artillery --help


Usage: artillery [options] [command]


Commands:

  run [options] <script>  Run a test script. Example: `artillery run benchmark.yml`
  quick [options] <url>   Run a quick test without writing a test script
  report <file>           Create a report from a JSON file created by "artillery run"

Options:

  -h, --help     output usage information
  -V, --version  output the version number
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Artillery Features in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This snippet uses Markdown to list the key features of Artillery, including cloud-native testing, Playwright integration, and extensibility.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
## Features

- **Test at cloud scale.** Cloud-native distributed load testing at scale, **out-of-the box and for free**.
  - Scale out your load tests on top of AWS Lambda or AWS Fargate. No DevOps needed, zero infrastructure to set up or manage.
- **Test with Playwright**. Load test with real headless browsers.
- **Batteries-included.** 20+ integrations for monitoring, observability, and CICD.
- **Test anything**. HTTP, WebSocket, Socket.io, gRPC, Kinesis, and more.
- **Powerful workload modeling**. Emulate complex user behavior with request chains, multiple steps, transactions, and more.
- **Extensible & hackable**. Artillery has a plugin API to allow extending and customization.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Artillery via NPM
DESCRIPTION: Command to globally install the Artillery load testing tool using npm package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/packages/artillery/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install -g artillery
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Memory Inspector Plugin in Artillery YAML Configuration
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration example showing how to set up the memory-inspector plugin in an Artillery test script. It demonstrates monitoring multiple processes with custom names and running a basic web request test against a local server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/packages/artillery-plugin-memory-inspector/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
config:
  target: "http://localhost:4444"
  phases:
    - duration: 600
      arrivalRate: 3
      name: "Phase 1"
  processor: "./myProcessor.js"
  plugins:
    memory-inspector:
      - pid: 60754
        name: memory-leak-express
      - pid: 11216
        name: stable-state

scenarios:
  - flow:
      - get:
          url: "/"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Azure Pipelines CI/CD Configuration for Artillery
DESCRIPTION: Azure Pipelines configuration that automates load testing on code pushes to main branch and runs daily scheduled tests at 12:00 AM UTC. Includes HTML report generation and artifact storage.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/cicd/azure-devops/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
azure-pipelines.yml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing Jenkins Pipeline for Scheduled Artillery Load Testing
DESCRIPTION: This Jenkins Pipeline configuration sets up a scheduled job to run Artillery load tests daily at midnight. It executes the test, generates an HTML report, and archives the results as artifacts.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/cicd/jenkins/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: groovy
CODE:
```
Jenkinsfile
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Artillery Functional Tests
DESCRIPTION: This command executes Artillery functional tests using the functional environment configuration, which enables the artillery-plugin-expect plugin for assertions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/functional-testing-with-expect-plugin/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
npx artillery run --environment functional functional-load-tests.yml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring CircleCI Workflow for Artillery Load Testing
DESCRIPTION: This YAML configuration sets up a CircleCI workflow to run Artillery load tests automatically. It triggers tests on pushes to the main branch and schedules daily tests at 12:00 AM UTC. The workflow generates and stores HTML reports as artifacts.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/cicd/circleci/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
.circleci/config.yml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Artillery Load Tests
DESCRIPTION: This command executes Artillery load tests using the load environment configuration, which generates 25 virtual users per second for 10 minutes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/functional-testing-with-expect-plugin/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
npx artillery run --environment load functional-load-tests.yml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Artillery Performance Metrics Output
DESCRIPTION: Example of the performance metrics output generated by Artillery, showing both backend and browser-level metrics.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/browser-load-testing-playwright/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
vusers.created_by_name.Dev account signup: .................. 10
vusers.created.total: ....................................... 10
vusers.completed: ........................................... 10
vusers.session_length:
  min: ...................................................... 3884.2
  max: ...................................................... 13846.2
  median: ................................................... 12711.5
  p95: ...................................................... 12968.3
  p99: ...................................................... 12968.3
browser.page_domcontentloaded: ........................... 20
browser.response_time:
  min: ...................................................... 0
  max: ...................................................... 1778.8
  median: ................................................... 37.7
  p95: ...................................................... 3828.5
  p99: ...................................................... 3828.5
browser.page_domcontentloaded.dominteractive:
  min: ...................................................... 297
  max: ...................................................... 2247
  median: ................................................... 1002.4
  p95: ...................................................... 1939.5
  p99: ...................................................... 1939.5
browser.page_domcontentloaded.dominteractive.https://artillery.io/:
  min: ...................................................... 427
  max: ...................................................... 2247
  median: ................................................... 1130.2
  p95: ...................................................... 1939.5
  p99: ...................................................... 1939.5
browser.page_domcontentloaded.dominteractive.https://artillery.io/pro/:
  min: ...................................................... 297
  max: ...................................................... 1927
  median: ................................................... 596
  p95: ...................................................... 1380.5
  p99: ...................................................... 1380.5
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generated Artillery Test Script for Kubernetes Service
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet shows the Artillery test script generated by kubectl-artillery. It includes configuration for the target service and a basic health check scenario.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/k8s-testing-with-kubectl-artillery/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
config:
  target: http://movie-browser-service:80/
  environments:
    functional:
      phases:
        - duration: 1
          arrivalCount: 1
      plugins:
        expect: {}
scenarios:
  - flow:
      - get:
          url: http://movie-browser-service:80/healthz
          expect:
            - statusCode: 200
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Artillery Load Test
DESCRIPTION: This command executes the Artillery test script (test.yml) to perform load testing on the WebSockets server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/websockets/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npx artillery run test.yml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Artillery Socket.IO Test Configuration in YAML
DESCRIPTION: Example Artillery test script configuration for testing a Socket.IO server. The test is accessible via the Artillery REPL and can be executed within Azure Pipelines.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/cicd/azure-devops/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
tests/performance/socket-io.yml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Artillery Test with Custom Metrics
DESCRIPTION: Command to execute the Artillery test script that includes custom metrics tracking. The script uses afterResponse hooks to track a counter and a histogram of request latency.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/track-custom-metrics/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
artillery run custom-metrics.yml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Artillery Load Test for Socket.IO Server in YAML
DESCRIPTION: This YAML configuration defines an Artillery load test script for a Socket.IO server. It specifies the target, scenario, and test phases for load testing a Socket.IO application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/cicd/jenkins/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
tests/performance/socket-io.yml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Artillery Load Test for Socket.IO
DESCRIPTION: This command executes the Artillery test script (socket-io.yml) to perform load testing on the running Socket.IO server. The script contains various test scenarios for Socket.IO implementation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/socket-io/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npx artillery run socket-io.yml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Artillery Load Test Against GraphQL Server
DESCRIPTION: Executes the Artillery test script (graphql.yml) that contains scenarios for testing various queries and mutations on the GraphQL server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/graphql-api-server/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
npx artillery run graphql.yml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Artillery Load Test for Socket.IO Server
DESCRIPTION: This YAML file contains an Artillery test script for load testing a Socket.IO server. It defines the test scenarios, configurations, and metrics to be collected during the performance test.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/cicd/circleci/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
tests/performance/socket-io.yml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deploying and Running Artillery Test on Kubernetes
DESCRIPTION: This shell command applies the Kustomize manifests to deploy and run the Artillery test job on the Kubernetes cluster.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/k8s-testing-with-kubectl-artillery/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
kubectl apply -k artillery-manifests
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Sample PostHog Load Testing Configuration in YAML
DESCRIPTION: Example Artillery configuration script that demonstrates how to set up a load test for PostHog. It includes target configuration, API key setup, test phases, and a scenario that captures events with properties.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/packages/artillery-engine-posthog/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
config:
  target: "https://posthog.acme.corp"
  posthog:
    apiKey: "{{ $processEnvironment.POSTHOG_API_KEY }}"
  phases:
    - arrivalCount: 5
      duration: 10
  engines:
    posthog: {}
scenarios:
  - name: "posthog engine test"
    engine: posthog
    flow:
      - count: 3
        loop:
        - capture:
            distinctId: "distinct id"
            event: "movie played"
            properties:
              movieId: "Die Hard"
              category: "Christmas"
        - think: 2
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring New Relic Plugin in Artillery YAML
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the basic configuration for the New Relic plugin in Artillery. It sets the plugin type, API key, metric prefix, and custom attributes for the metrics.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/packages/artillery-plugin-publish-metrics/lib/newrelic/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
config:
  plugins:
    publish-metrics:
      - type: newrelic
        apiKey: '{{ $processEnvironment.NEW_RELIC_LICENSE_KEY }}'
        prefix: 'artillery.'
        attributes:
          - 'type:soak-test'
          - 'service:my-service'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generated Kubernetes Job Manifest for Artillery Test
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet shows a portion of the generated Kubernetes Job manifest for running the Artillery test. It includes metadata labels for identifying the test components.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/k8s-testing-with-kubectl-artillery/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
apiVersion: batch/v1
kind: Job
metadata:
  labels:
    artillery.io/component: test-worker-master
    artillery.io/part-of: artilleryio-test
    artillery.io/test-name: movie-browser-service
  name: movie-browser-service
  namespace: default
...
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Batch Running Multiple Artillery Scenarios
DESCRIPTION: Shell script to iterate through and execute multiple Artillery scenario files in sequence using a common configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/multiple-scenario-specs/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
for scenarioFile in `ls scenarios/*.yml` ; do
  artillery run --config common-config.yml scenarios/$scenarioFile
done
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Artillery Tests with Cookie Handling
DESCRIPTION: Command to execute the Artillery test script (cookies.yml) that demonstrates different ways to work with cookies when testing HTTP services.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/using-cookies/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
artillery run cookies.yml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Artillery Splunk Plugin Configuration
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration example for the Artillery Splunk plugin. Shows how to set up metrics publishing with custom dimensions, event tracking, and environment-based access token configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/packages/artillery-plugin-publish-metrics/lib/splunk/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
config:
  plugins:
    publish-metrics:
      - type: splunk
        realm: eu0
        # SP_ACCESS_TOKEN is an environment variable containing the API key
        accessToken: '{{ $processEnvironment.SP_ACCESS_TOKEN }}'
        prefix: 'artillery.publish_metrics_plugin.'
        dimensions:
          - 'host:server_1'
          - 'host_id:1.2.3.4'
        event:
          eventType: 'Artillery_load_test'
          dimensions:
            - 'environment:production'
            - 'testId:myTest123'
          properties:
            - 'use:QA'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Artillery Tests with Playwright Code
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the Artillery performance test that uses the same Playwright test code, demonstrating the reuse of test logic between frameworks.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/browser-playwright-reuse-typescript/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd performance && npx artillery run search-for-ts-doc.yml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: SOAP Metrics Output Example
DESCRIPTION: Sample output showing custom metrics tracked during SOAP load testing, including request counts, response times, and statistical measurements.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/soap-with-custom-function/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
soap.addNumbers.requests: ...................................................... 8
soap.addNumbers.response_time:
  min: ......................................................................... 2
  max: ......................................................................... 9
  mean: ........................................................................ 4.9
  median: ...................................................................... 2
  p95: ......................................................................... 7.9
  p99: ......................................................................... 7.9
soap.addNumbers.responses: ..................................................... 8
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Artillery Script with Token Authentication
DESCRIPTION: Command to execute the Artillery script that demonstrates token-based authentication. This command runs the auth-with-token.yml configuration file which implements both shared and VU-specific token generation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/generating-vu-tokens/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
artillery run auth-with-token.yml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Dynamically Overriding Artillery Test Parameters at Runtime
DESCRIPTION: Executes an Artillery test with the 'dynamic' environment while overriding the load phase parameters using environment variables ARRIVAL_RATE and DURATION to control the test intensity and length.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/script-overrides/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
ARRIVAL_RATE=20 DURATION=600 artillery run -e dynamic test.yaml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Artillery Test with Preprod Environment Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Executes an Artillery test using the 'preprod' environment configuration which applies a higher TPS longer phase for preprod testing with hardcoded values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/script-overrides/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
npx artillery run -e preprod test.yaml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting the GraphQL Server for Load Testing
DESCRIPTION: Launches the Apollo GraphQL server that will be the target of Artillery load tests. The server will be available at http://localhost:4000/.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/graphql-api-server/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
node app.js
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Artillery Tests on AWS Fargate with Authentication
DESCRIPTION: Command to run Artillery tests at scale on AWS Fargate with a specified number of workers, including authentication reuse.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/browser-playwright-reuse-authentication/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
npx artillery run:fargate scenario.yml --count 2
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Artillery Load Test Against Twirp Server
DESCRIPTION: Command to execute the Artillery load test using the scenario file that contains the configuration for testing the Twirp RPC service.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/rpc-twirp-with-custom-function/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npx artillery run ./test/scenario.yml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Viewing Artillery Test Results from Kubernetes Logs
DESCRIPTION: This shell command retrieves and displays the logs from the Artillery test worker pod, showing the test results and metrics.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/k8s-testing-with-kubectl-artillery/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
kubectl logs pod/movie-browser-service-9xnsn
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Advanced New Relic Plugin Configuration with Event Settings
DESCRIPTION: This YAML configuration expands on the basic setup by including event-specific settings. It demonstrates how to configure custom event types, account IDs, and additional event attributes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/packages/artillery-plugin-publish-metrics/lib/newrelic/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
config:
  plugins:
    publish-metrics:
      - type: newrelic
        apiKey: '{{ $processEnvironment.NEW_RELIC_LICENSE_KEY }}'
        prefix: 'artillery.'
        attributes:
          - 'type:soak-test'
          - 'service:my-service'
        event:
          accountId: '{{ $processEnvironment.NEW_RELIC_ACCOUNT_ID }}'
          eventType: 'Artillery_load_test'
          attributes:
            'alertType:info'
            'priority:low'
            'testId:myTest123'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Artillery Load Test with TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: Command to run a simple load test using a Playwright script written in TypeScript.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/browser-load-testing-playwright/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
npx artillery run browser-load-test.ts
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Scaffolding Artillery Test Script from Kubernetes Service
DESCRIPTION: This shell command uses kubectl-artillery to generate an Artillery test script based on the movie-browser-service Kubernetes Service.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/k8s-testing-with-kubectl-artillery/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
kubectl artillery scaffold movie-browser-service
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Artillery Test with Smoke Environment Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Executes an Artillery test using the 'smoke' environment configuration which applies a low TPS short phase for smoke testing with hardcoded values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/script-overrides/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
npx artillery run -e smoke test.yaml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Artillery Load Test with Automated Checks
DESCRIPTION: Command to execute the Artillery load test script with automated checks. This runs the test configuration defined in the YAML file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/automated-checks/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
artillery run test-with-automated-checks.yml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running a Skytrace Flow with hot-reload
DESCRIPTION: This command runs a Skytrace flow defined in 'asciiart-flow.yml' with the hot-reload feature enabled (-r flag). Changes to the file will trigger automatic re-runs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/packages/skytrace/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
skytrace run -r asciiart-flow.yml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Checking Artillery Test Job Status on Kubernetes
DESCRIPTION: This shell command retrieves the status of all Kubernetes resources related to the Artillery test job.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/k8s-testing-with-kubectl-artillery/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
kubectl get all -l artillery.io/part-of=artilleryio-test
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Artillery with Playwright Authentication Reuse
DESCRIPTION: Command to execute the Artillery test scenario that demonstrates authentication reuse with Playwright.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/browser-playwright-reuse-authentication/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
npx artillery run scenario.yml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Health Check Endpoint in Movie Browser Server
DESCRIPTION: This JavaScript snippet shows the implementation of the health check endpoint in the Movie Browser HTTP test server. It responds with a 200 status if movie data is available.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/k8s-testing-with-kubectl-artillery/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
app.get('/healthz', (req, res) => {
  if (response.length > 0) {
    res.status(200).send('Ok');
  } else {
    res.status(500).send('Movie data is missing');
  }
});
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Single Artillery Scenario
DESCRIPTION: Command to execute a single Artillery scenario using the --config flag to specify common configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/multiple-scenario-specs/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
artillery run --config common-config.yml scenarios/armadillo.yml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Artillery Test
DESCRIPTION: Command to execute the Artillery test script for SOAP load testing
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/soap-with-custom-function/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npx artillery run soap.yml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Artillery Memory Inspector Plugin via npm
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the artillery-plugin-memory-inspector package globally using npm. This allows usage of the plugin in Artillery test scripts for memory monitoring.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/packages/artillery-plugin-memory-inspector/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
npm install -g artillery-plugin-memory-inspector
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting up KinD Cluster for Kubernetes Testing
DESCRIPTION: This shell command runs a script to set up a KinD (Kubernetes in Docker) cluster locally. It's used to prepare a Kubernetes environment for testing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/k8s-testing-with-kubectl-artillery/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
./hack/kind/kind-with-registry.sh
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Artillery to Include Authentication Storage for Fargate
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration snippet showing how to include the storage.json file when running tests on AWS Fargate to ensure proper authentication reuse.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/browser-playwright-reuse-authentication/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
  config:
    ...
    includeFiles:
        - ./storage.json
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating Kubernetes Job for Artillery Test
DESCRIPTION: This shell command uses kubectl-artillery to generate a Kubernetes Job manifest that will run the Artillery test script in the cluster.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/k8s-testing-with-kubectl-artillery/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
kubectl artillery generate movie-browser-service -s artillery-scripts/test-script_movie-browser-service.yaml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Debugging Artillery Splunk Plugin
DESCRIPTION: Command to enable debug logging for the Splunk metrics publishing plugin. Sets the DEBUG environment variable to view detailed debugging messages.

TITLE: Redis Connection and Usage with Artillery
DESCRIPTION: The document describes how to use Redis with Artillery for unique user data access. It explains the process of seeding Redis with users and retrieving them using lpop in a beforeScenario hook.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/using-data-from-redis/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
# Using Data from Redis

Due to Artillery's concurrent nature, there is no way to guarantee that test data used (e.g. using CSV) is uniquely accessed by your virtual users, especially running distributed load tests.

In some cases, you may require users to be unique. In those cases, using Redis is a simple alternative. You can use your own Redis (e.g. AWS Elasticache), or use a managed solution like Upstash. We recommend Upstash due to its simplicity and serverless nature.

This example will show you how to connect an Artillery test to an Upstash Redis instance, and pull a unique user each time.

## Pre-requisites

- Create an Upstash account
- Follow the simple guide to create an [Upstash Redis instance](https://upstash.com/docs/redis/overall/getstarted)
- Obtain the `endpoint` and `token` from the UI

## How it works

We'll first seed a Redis database with auto-generated users. Using a [`beforeScenario`](https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/engines/http#function-actions-and-beforescenario--afterscenario-hooks) hook we pull a unique user per VU from Redis (`using Redis lpop`), and save its username and password in `context.vars`. 

The scenario is then simply logging the username and password to the console to demonstrate that they are unique.

## Running the example

- First, create a `.env` file in this directory, with the same contents as `.env.sample`, filling in the information with your endpoint and token.
- Run `npm install` in this directory to install the needed dependencies
- Run `npm run seed` to seed the Redis instance with 100 auto-generated users (username and password)

You can now run your Artillery test with `npm run test`. You'll see the users printed to the console.

## Additional thoughts

- We seed the database in a separate script. However, you could easily run the seeding step as part of a [`before`](https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/test-script#before-and-after-sections) hook if desired
- If you're interested in the additional overhead of pulling the user from Redis, you can run the test with the `SHOW_TIMING=true` variable. Redis is very fast, and typically each call should only add <30 ms to each VU execution (depending on factors like instance sizes, size of the load test, network, etc)
```

TITLE: Kustomize Manifest for Artillery Test Configuration
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet shows the Kustomize manifest used to create a ConfigMap for the Artillery test script and configure the test deployment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/k8s-testing-with-kubectl-artillery/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
kind: Kustomization
apiVersion: kustomize.config.k8s.io/v1beta1
namespace: default
resources:
  - test-job.yaml
configMapGenerator:
  - name: movie-browser-service-test-script
    files:
      - test-script_movie-browser-service.yaml
generatorOptions:
  labels:
    artillery.io/component: artilleryio-test-config
    artillery.io/part-of: artilleryio-test
  disableNameSuffixHash: true
```

DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the proper format for commit messages following the commitlint conventional config. Includes a brief one-liner title in imperative mood, followed by an optional detailed explanation wrapped at 72 characters.

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:

```
feat: A brief one-liner < 50 chars, use the imperative mood

Followed by further explanation if needed, this should be wrapped at
around 72 characters. Most commits should reference an existing
issue, such as #101 above.
```

TITLE: Starting Netcat Server for Artillery Testing
DESCRIPTION: This command starts a netcat server in listening mode on port 31337. It's used to receive and display the HTTP requests sent by Artillery, allowing verification of custom headers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/http-set-custom-header/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
nc -l 31337
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Artillery Test with Custom Header
DESCRIPTION: This command executes the Artillery test script 'set-header.yml', which is configured to send requests with a custom HTTP header. The script likely contains the JavaScript hook function for setting the custom header.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/http-set-custom-header/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
artillery run set-header.yml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Incompatible With Secondary Licenses Notice Template
DESCRIPTION: Notice text that must be included when source code is incompatible with secondary licenses under MPL 2.0.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/packages/artillery-plugin-fake-data/LICENSE.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
This Source Code Form is "Incompatible
With Secondary Licenses", as defined by
the Mozilla Public License, v. 2.0.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Twirp Server Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: Command to change directory to the twirp folder and install the necessary dependencies for the Twirp server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/rpc-twirp-with-custom-function/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd twirp && npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Socket.IO Server
DESCRIPTION: This command starts the Socket.IO server. It runs the app.js file, which sets up a server listening on http://localhost:8080/.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/examples/socket-io/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
node app.js
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Artillery Version Support Matrix in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Markdown table showing which Artillery versions receive security updates. Version 2.x.x is supported while versions 1.7.x and earlier are not supported.
SOURCE: https://github.com/artilleryio/artillery/blob/main/SECURITY.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Version | Supported          |
| ------- | ------------------ |
| 2.x.x   | :white_check_mark: |
| 1.7.x   | :x:                |
| < 1.7   | :x:                |
```

----------------------------------------
